alerts.headline: frost advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Temperatures are expected to drop to near the freezing mark overnight into Thursday morning.

Frost may return for some locations Thursday night into Friday morning.

###

Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Cover up plants, especially those in frost-prone areas.

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: frost advisory in effect

Near freezing temperatures are expected early this morning.

Frost may return for some locations tonight into Friday morning.

###

Frost advisories are issued when temperatures are expected to reach the freezing mark during the growing season, leading to potential damage and destruction to plants and crops.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: frost advisory ended
alerts.description:
Widespread frost is no longer expected.


###

affected_areas.area_description: Kakabeka Falls - Whitefish Lake - Arrow Lake

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
What:
Rain, at times heavy, is expected.

Hazard:
Total rainfall amounts of 50 to 60 mm. 

Timing:
Through this afternoon.

Additional information:
Near 30 mm rain has been reported in this area. Additional 20 to 30 mm rain is expected before rain tapers off to showers this evening.

###

Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Watch for possible washouts near rivers, creeks and culverts.
